here’s some r code


plot(iris)

title: Welcome to BLOG
contents:
HOW TO MAKE THIS WEBSITE

FOLLOW THE STEPS HERE (WITH A TWEAK)
https://youtu.be/unur6FBh_x0

PRE-REQUISITES

Download R

Download R Studio

Install packages:
distill
usethis
gircreds

Make a github (online) profile

Link your R Studio to github : steps 9.1, 9.3, 9.4 (in guide by Jenny Bryan https://happygitwithr.com/https-pat.html)
Go to GITHUB - Create a repo(sitory)
New
Public

Go to R Studio
clone from github (online) to local drive (R Studio)
Still in RStudio – create a file structure locally for the blog
Install.packages(“distill”, dependencies = TRUE)
library(distill)
tell it to make a blog
Close RStudio to make the build tab appear
Back to GITHUB and select Settings > Pages > and set up
So built from the /docs folder in the main branch
Back to RStudio
In console:
file.create(“.nojekyll”)
confirmed by response TRUE
Still in RStudio
Set up docs folder in local version of blog
Edit the _site.yml file
output_dir: docs
save
In lower right files panel, delete _site which is not used
Still in RSudio select Build tab
Select BUILD WEBSITE (this talks to distill to build the folder locally)
Result will be news files created locally including docs folder
RStudio
Additional step
Tell git to see the docs folder
Edit gitignore
Comment out the docs/
save
select git tab
select all, stage, commit, add comment, push to git,
go to git hub, all the docs are there
go to pages, and you can follow the link to the live blog hosted from github (and not locally)
Now back in RStudio, lets add some pages,
library(distill)
create_post(“I love blogging”)
add some content to the file (top right), can also include {r} code and include the code and the output using echo=TRUE
save and knit
preview from local version *not yet on github
